intro: Schulzia prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate schulzia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in a prostrate or creeping manner, forming dense mats on the ground. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Schulzia prostrata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive blooms and hardy nature.
